title: What causes sinkholes, and can they be predicted? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sinkholes are large caverns whose roof has collapsed. If you know there is a large cavern near the surface, it is a good bet that a sinkhole will eventually form there. Signs of sinkholes are isolated depressions, areas where water drains to a central location, possibly forming a short-lived pond, and then the water quickly disappears into the ground. The rapid draining underground indicates a conduit for the water flow…open space underground…a cavern system. Look up Karst Topography. From Wikipedia:
